name: places/ChIJiy46nqJYwokRw48Gkk14aUM
formattedAddress: 2 E 88th St, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2 E 88th St, New York, NY 10128-0555, USA

originalText.text:
18 years ago, I got attacked. My thumb was dislocated and unable to be  secured in socket without surgery.
I went to NYU because of their reputation, got referred to Dr Martin Posner. Nice straight forward guy.
Long story short, my thumb he operated on and fixed
works better than the uninjured thumb on my other hand.
18 years later and I'm able to play sports and do everyday activities with my hand.
I appreciate the work he did and am very thankful.  He does great work.

originalText.text:
I was a FDNY FF in 2003. I jumped off the second story of a setback and landed in Concertina wire.
The razor wire severed my right hand, index finger, adductor muscle, wrist and forearm. After seeing several doctors who basically said,”we can fix your index finger in a static position forever”. I then consulted with Dr. Posner who said he could get the finger working again. Well he did, without any discomfort, or immobility. My finger 18 years later is as good as it was prior to my accident. Kudos to you sir. Dr.Posner is truly a genius when it comes to issues with the hand. I recommend him to anyone with a problem with the hand.

originalText.text: 2006 I dislocated & broke my wrist at a fire (I am FDNY firefighter) and had complication with my hand. Dr. Posner was my surgeon & did an amazing job getting me back to functioning with my hand. Just a great Doctor & surgeon. Really cared about my well being & gave me all the information on my injury and what was going to take place.
